data.title: Stonewall Uprising (2010)
data.meta_description: Stonewall Uprising is a 2010 American documentary film examining the events surrounding the Stonewall riots that began during the early hours of June 28, 1969. Stonewall Uprising made its theatrical debut on June 16, 2010 at the Film Forum in New York City.The movie features interviews with eyewitnesses to the incident, including NYPD deputy inspector Seymour Pine. The film was produced and directed by documentarians Kate Davis and David Heilbroner, and is based on the book by historian David Carter, Stonewall: The Riots That Sparked the Gay Revolution. The title theme is by Gary Lionelli.
data.text:
☆"The very idea of being 'out' was ludicrous. People talk about being in and out now; there was no 'out,' there was just 'in.'"☆

Fifty years ago, the NYPD violently raided a gay bar -- "they are to gay people what churches are to blacks in the South," says a man minutes into this film -- the Stonewall Inn. It took literally until this week for the police commissioner to apologize for the oppressive assault on this community, an incident which many call "the Rosa Parks moment" for the LGBTQ civil rights movement. During Pride Month, it certainly felt appropriate to watch this documentary film this afternoon, long on my watchlist.

It's only available thanks to a special rebroadcast by…
